availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Pennsylvania native. Married to Rachel Crail White in Pendleton County in December 1844. Father of Samuel F. White, John B. White, William White, Margaret S. White, Charles A. White, Sarah M. White, and Daniel White. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District No. 1, p. 379A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 652.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct No. 4, p. 447A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000272800.
Eric C. Nagle and Larry L. Ford, Monument Inscriptions of Pendleton County, Kentucky, (Huber Heights, OH: 1994), 253.
